intro: Diclinanona calycina var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved diclinanona, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display. The varietal name *macrophylla* refers to its notably large leaves, a distinguishing feature of this particular variant.
